title: Create 5 minute tutorial
description: Per the new site design for Solr, we'd like to have a 5 minutes to Solr tutorial that covers users getting their data in and querying it.

comments.author: Taka
comments.content:
Here's my first draft (v0.1) for the 5 minute tutorial (in markdown).Please post any feedback.

For the future release of Solr, I would like to update or add better examples. Should I file this separately in JIRA?

comments.author: Taka
comments.content: I will include instructions for Windows later. v0.1 is only for unix-based systems.

comments.author: Varun Thacker
comments.content:
I think we should edit point 1 to be - "Apache Solr runs of Java 7 or greater" instead of "Java 1.7 u55 or higher."

I don't think we need to point out that it is recommended to use u55 for someone just wanting to try out Solr in 5 mins. 

Regarding Point 4 - Maybe we could spin this into another issue but currently 
The CSV example has 10 documents.
The JSON example has 4 documents.
The XML example has 32 documents. 

We should at least have the same documents in all the examples and have slightly more documents in each?

comments.author: Varun Thacker
comments.content: Created SOLR-6127 for the exampledocs improvements

comments.author: Erik Hatcher
comments.content: I've completed the tutorial overhaul, for Solr 4.10.x effectively.   Closing this issue, though the tutorial will eventually need to be updated for 5.0.

comments.author: Alexandre Rafalovitch
comments.content:
Two issues:

1. The tutorial is not using post.jar but is using the full class name. Why? It's error prone and nobody seem to be deleting post.jar yet
2. What does this mean for the tutorial that is bundled with the distribution? Now we have two "follow-the tutorial" path. We may need to be a bit more explicit about which one is which.
